metadata.synopsis: Daisy reacts to whichever route we took to learn that the tadpoles are imbued with special magic. They tell us that it’s part of a greater sickness. The Cult of the Absolute is winning a war nobody is aware of - if they are victorious we will all be doomed. But we can stop this if we join Daisy in the quest to bring down the Absolute. We need to use our powers to infiltrate the ranks. At the end of the dream, Daisy gives us a new tadpole power.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Have at least one companion in your partyGot to act 1 Queue camp nightLong rest

5.context: CinematicNodeContext: We come to, in the dream field. Daisy is there, back to us. They turn to speak to us.NodeContext: Daisy turns to face player on her left

79.context: CinematicNodeContext: We come to, in the dream field. Daisy is there, back to us. They turn to speak to us.NodeContext: Daisy turns to face player on her left

19.text: Don't worry - I have things under control. For now.
19.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player glances towards where battle was happening. Daisy clocks player's glance. NodeContext: Daisy facing player

40.text: I see you've been using the powers the tadpole gives you - good.
40.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy clocks our uncertain reaction.

17.text: And you haven't tried to have it removed.
17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy clocks our uncertain reaction.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: I never want to live in the darkness again.

89.text: And you will never have to, if you listen to me.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: I'm worried I'll go mad if I take it out.

107.speaker: Player
107.text: I trusted that you would protect me.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: It might not be the worst thing, to become a mind flayer.

16.text: You are open-minded - a good quality to have.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: I couldn't find anyone who could help me.

54.text: It would have made little difference if you had.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: If it doesn't transform me, what's the harm in keeping it around?

68.text: It may not transform you immediately, but it's only a matter of time.

105.text: But things haven't gone as you expected.
105.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy clocks our uncertain reaction.

38.text: You hoped a druid as powerful as Halsin might be able to remove your tadpole. But he couldn't.

73.text: You hoped the fey magic of the hag might be enough to remove your tadpole. But it wasn't.

76.text: You thought a mind flayer might know how to extricate one of its own from you, but Omeluum couldn't help you. Your tadpole lives.

88.text: You thought Nettie might be able to help you in the druids' grove. But all she did was try to kill you.

15.text: You thought Nettie might be able to help you in the druids' grove. But all she did was reaffirm the danger.

100.text: You're desperate to be rid of it. Understandable, but you're looking for solutions in the wrong places.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: So what should I be doing?

66.speaker: Player
66.text: I don't care about the tadpole. I have been offered a greater power by my butler.

91.text: Ambition is good. You are resourceful and will gather many allies to aid your strength. Use them how you will.

74.text: But whatever you do, a word of advice: do not listen to that false butler.

50.text: He knows nothing of what the tadpole is capable of.

60.text: It's complicated. But I'm an adventurer, just like you.

4.text: Just like you, I was infected with a mind flayer parasite. Just like you, I seek to be free of it.

59.text: But to do that, we'll need to think beyond local healers.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Halsin mentioned that these tadpoles have been modified with magic.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Auntie Ethel mentioned there was Netherese magic involved.

72.text: The hag did not deceive you on this front.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Omeluum mentioned some sort of strange magic preventing the tadpole from being removed - what do you know about that?

43.text: You needed to see for yourself. And now you have.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: There must be some way to get rid of the tadpole.

21.text: There is. But you'll need to think beyond local healers.

18.text: Your parasite is unusual - it is wrapped in magic that prevents its removal.

102.text: Until the source of the tadpole's magic is destroyed, any attempt to remove it will kill you.

42.text: You were lucky that you only lost an eye. You could have lost much more.

55.text: The parasites are merely a symptom of a greater sickness in Faerûn.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: How do I destroy the source of the tadpole's magic?

25.text: I am not sure, yet. To find the answers, we must first find the source.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: I thought you said you could protect me?

64.text: From transforming into a mind flayer, yes. But that is not the only thing these parasites can do.

41.text: The Absolute's aims are not yet clear to me. But its progress towards domination is clear.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: How do you know so much about these tadpoles?

11.text: I have kept a careful watch on the movements of the cult. Though the Absolute's aims are not yet clear to me, its methods are.

98.text: These parasites are more than illithid spawn - they are vessels for control.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: Tell me more about this magic.

90.text: It imbues the parasites with special powers. Some that benefit, most that harm.

48.text: But more importantly, it enables the hosts to be controlled.

34.text: The infected hear the voice of the Absolute, and believe it to be a god.

45.text: You witnessed it yourself with Priestess Gut.

99.text: That is how the cult of the Absolute is spreading.

77.text: The highest of their rank - the True Souls - carry a tadpole just like yours. It is how they receive their orders. It is what makes them obey.

63.text: The highest of their rank are called True Souls. They carry a tadpole just like yours. It is how they receive their orders. It is what makes them obey.

65.text: When the order to transform is given, it will not be a matter of days - they will be mind flayers in an instant.

69.text: Were it not for my protection, so would you.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: My mind tells me to do foul things. Are you sure your protection is working?

0.text: I protect you from becoming a mind flayer - I cannot protect you from yourself.

110.text: But I know what it is like to be burdened by forces outside of your control.

35.text: We are alike, you and I.

57.speaker: Player
57.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy reacts to thunder and a flash of lightning in the background. The Orpheus screams as the conflict intensifies.NodeContext: Daisy looks to her right at the battle field

44.speaker: Player
44.text: How is it that you protect me?
44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy reacts to thunder and a flash of lightning in the background. The Orpheus screams as the conflict intensifies.NodeContext: Daisy looks to her right at the battle field

71.text: I have powers of my own, unique powers. But know that we are alike.

14.speaker: Player
14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy reacts to thunder and a flash of lightning in the background. The Orpheus screams as the conflict intensifies.NodeContext: Daisy looks to her right at the battle field

30.text: Because I am just like you. And I need an ally.
30.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy reacts to thunder and a flash of lightning in the background. The Orpheus screams as the conflict intensifies.NodeContext: Daisy looks to her right at the battle field

81.text: I've been trying to escape from this evil for a long time. Once, I almost succeeded.
81.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy reacts to thunder and a flash of lightning in the background. The Orpheus screams as the conflict intensifies.NodeContext: Daisy looks to her right at the battle field

13.text: Now, through you, I've been given a new chance. You can go where I cannot. And I can protect you from that evil.
13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy reacts to thunder and a flash of lightning in the background. The Orpheus screams as the conflict intensifies.NodeContext: Daisy looks to her right at the battle field

112.text: If we work together, we may turn this around.
112.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy reacts to thunder and a flash of lightning in the background. The Orpheus screams as the conflict intensifies.NodeContext: Daisy looks to her right at the battle field

9.text: Hells. They need me. I have to go.
9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy reacts to thunder and a flash of lightning in the background. The Orpheus screams as the conflict intensifies.NodeContext: Daisy looks to her right at the battle field

33.speaker: Player
33.text: What is going on over there?
33.context: NodeContext: urgent No! Before calming back down to rational explanation

53.speaker: Player
53.text: Is there anything I can do to help you?
53.context: NodeContext: urgent No! Before calming back down to rational explanation

97.text: No. I can handle this. For now.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Tell me where I can find you.
26.context: NodeContext: urgent No! Before calming back down to rational explanation

3.context: NodeContext: urgent No! Before calming back down to rational explanation

31.text: The power I use to protect you, I stole it from someone. They want it back.
31.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Daisy places a hand above your forehead. A brief glow. (New tadpole powers.) 

Then the player wakes.NodeContext: Daisy gently raise up her hand and gesture (Star Wars Jedi Mind Trick)

101.text: I will hold them off for as long as I can, but sooner or later I will be worn down.
101.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Daisy places a hand above your forehead. A brief glow. (New tadpole powers.) 

Then the player wakes.NodeContext: Daisy gently raise up her hand and gesture (Star Wars Jedi Mind Trick)

67.text: You must discover the source of the magic that controls the parasites before that happens.
67.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Daisy places a hand above your forehead. A brief glow. (New tadpole powers.) 

Then the player wakes.NodeContext: Daisy gently raise up her hand and gesture (Star Wars Jedi Mind Trick)

52.text: The cultists are gathering at Moonrise Towers.
52.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Daisy places a hand above your forehead. A brief glow. (New tadpole powers.) 

Then the player wakes.NodeContext: Daisy gently raise up her hand and gesture (Star Wars Jedi Mind Trick)

24.text: Follow the cultists' trail - they will lead you to their masters.
24.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Daisy places a hand above your forehead. A brief glow. (New tadpole powers.) 

Then the player wakes.NodeContext: Daisy gently raise up her hand and gesture (Star Wars Jedi Mind Trick)

84.text: Use the powers your parasite gives you to convince them you are one of them. And when you find the source of their magic, destroy it.
84.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Daisy places a hand above your forehead. A brief glow. (New tadpole powers.) 

Then the player wakes.NodeContext: Daisy gently raise up her hand and gesture (Star Wars Jedi Mind Trick)

95.text: Go. Our freedom depends on it.
95.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Daisy places a hand above your forehead. A brief glow. (New tadpole powers.) 

Then the player wakes.NodeContext: Daisy gently raise up her hand and gesture (Star Wars Jedi Mind Trick)

1.speaker: Player
1.text: Wait, what do you need me to do?

27.text: Because we share a common cause and a common enemy.

80.text: We share a common cause and a common enemy. Allegiances have been built on less.

70.text: Just like Nettie told you in the grove.

108.text: You were lucky that Omeluum realised this before he attempted a fatal extraction.

111.text: You were lucky that Halsin knew this. His instincts are right.

78.text: You haven't been using the parasite's power. You think you don't need it.
